definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: Its shadows are an ambush, its lights a surprise .
sentences.chinese: 它的陰影象伏兵千萬，它的光澤令人驚異。
“它們是令人驚異的動物，”羅賓遜說。

sentences.english: Mr. Swiveller looked, as he was, all open mouthed astonishment.
sentences.chinese: 斯威夫勒先生驚異得張開了嘴。

sentences.english: Shocking, half known arms thrown around dreams.
sentences.chinese: 驚異的，半知曉的手臂湧現夢海。

sentences.english: It's amazing that somebody can still contribute to society even in the autumn of his life.
sentences.chinese: 令人驚異的是，有人在垂暮之年還能夠爲社會作貢獻。

sentences.english: He is also, in some respects, surprisingly far-seeing.
sentences.chinese: 在某些方面，他也令人驚異地極富遠見。
他有着驚異非常的人物性格。

sentences.english: The noised classroom becomes quiet and we are astonished to look over at Ouyang.
sentences.chinese: 亂哄哄的教室靜了下來，我們驚異地望着歐陽老師。

sentences.english: Visitor are always surprised to find a door with another room behind.
sentences.chinese: 來訪者總是驚異地發現一扇門後別有洞天。
驚異和喜悅交織在一起。

sentences.english: Line renders are amazing looking renders that are often used on wallpapers or photo manipulations.
sentences.chinese: 行呈現是令人驚異找壁紙上經常使用或攝影手法呈現。

sentences.english: And hearing this they wondered, and leaving him, went their ways.
sentences.chinese: 他們聽了大爲驚異，遂離開他走了。

sentences.english: The result discovers uncannily , MorpheusCan make oblivious career is decelerated significantly.
sentences.chinese: 結果驚異地發現，睡眠能使遺忘的速度顯著減慢。

sentences.english: Startled at the stillness broken by reply so aptly spoken.
sentences.chinese: 驚異於那死寂漠漠被如此恰當的回話打破。

sentences.english: It is amazing that he (should) have said nothing about the murder.
sentences.chinese: 令人驚異的是他竟然對謀殺隻字未提。

sentences.english: The president's quick of affairs and his energy astounded the staff.
sentences.chinese: 總裁的幹才和精力都讓我們驚異。

definition: to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
